methodology.title: Assessment Methodology
methodology.content: Our CCRA methodology combines climate hazard data, exposure levels, and vulnerability indicators to calculate risk scores. We use a three-component model with additional adjustment for resilience factors. The process involves raw score calculation, normalization, and vulnerability adjustment based on resilience measures.

calculations.title: Risk Score Calculations
calculations.content:
Risk scores use a core formula: Risk = Hazard × Exposure × Vulnerability. Each component is normalized on a 0-1 scale.

The base components are:
• Hazard Score: Represents the likelihood and magnitude of a climate threat
• Exposure Score: Indicates how exposed an area is to the hazard
• Vulnerability Score: Measures how susceptible the area is to damage

Scores are then normalized using: Normalized Score = (Raw Score - Lower Bound) / (Upper Bound - Lower Bound)

resilience.title: Resilience Adjustment
resilience.content:
Resilience measures are incorporated through vulnerability adjustment:

• High resilience scores (>0.5) reduce vulnerability
• Low resilience scores (<0.5) increase vulnerability
• A resilience score of 0.5 maintains original vulnerability

The adjustment uses the formula: Adjusted Vulnerability = Original Vulnerability × (1 + (0.5 - Resilience Score))

quality.title: Quality Control
quality.content:
Our quality control measures include:

• Bounds Protection: All scores are constrained between 0.01 and 0.99
• Error Handling: Missing data returns null rather than incorrect calculations
• Data Tracking: Original scores are preserved alongside adjusted scores

features.content:
